result.execSummary:
The defendant Damon P Barnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Damon P Barnett is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Damon P Barnett was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

$243 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with PR and her dogs. No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any business where primary business is sale of alcohol.

Write mother letter of apology within 2 weeks to give agent for agent to send. Copy to Judge. Completion of certified domestic violence treatment. Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: W/huber. STAYED to be used by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damon P Barnett

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
